attributes.action: Provide an "extra small parcel" size service by Royal Mail.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently, to send a "Small Parcel" the specifics are:

Max W:2kg
Max L:45cm
Max Wi:35cm
Max T:16cm

The "Large Letter" specifics are:
Max W:750g
Max L:35.3cm
Max Wi:25cm
Max T:2.5cm

Price: "Large Letter"
-100g:0.98p
501g-750g:£2.52

As an example, I am sending multiple items, each with specifics of:

W:20g
L:7cm
Wi:5cm
T:4.5cm

It is too "Thick" to fit through a letterbox and classed as a "Small Parcel" at £2.90, 2nd Class

100 of the same item in the same parcel would cost £2.90
attributes.background:
A small item, but just big enough to not fit through a letter box is costing £2.90 for 2nd Class and £3.40 for 1st Class

A better price should be offered with pricing for items that comply with at least 2 or 3 sizing's for a Large Letter 

(Weight/Length/Width/Thickness) (W/L/Wi/T)

rejection.details:
This is an operational decision for Royal Mail, which has been privatised. You could raise this issue directly with Royal Mail itself.

You can find out more about how Royal Mail is regulated here:

http://www.royalmailgroup.com/about-us/regulation/how-were-regulated
